project.name: Qt
project.description: The Qt project manages the Qt ebuilds within Gentoo.

longdescription.p: The Qt project handles the Qt ebuilds available in Gentoo's portage and the qting-edge overlay. It also maintains various Qt packages and libraries that don't have dedicated maintainers.

goals.p: The goal of the Gentoo Qt team is have fully functional, up-to-date ebuilds for the Qt toolkit and various Qt applications. We also maintain eclasses that ease creation and maintainance of ebuilds using Qt.

body.p: For frequently asked questions and their answers, please consult our FAQ.
The Qt team has its regular meetings in #gentoo-meetings on the third Thursday of every month at 19:00 UTC. For earlier logs and summaries, please see the KDE team page.
Bugs, bugs, bugs! If you want to help, consider going through the Qt bug list: http://xrl.us/qtbugs. Any comment that can help a bug get fixed is always useful!
Those interested in writing ebuilds for Qt4 applications may find this tutorial useful: Qt4-based Ebuild HowTo.
Active contributors usually gain access to the qting-edge overlay to better help us with ebuild maintainance and can, in time, become full-fledged developers :)
To get in contact with the Qt team, drop by #gentoo-kde and chat with us, or send us an email at qt@gentoo.org.
